result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kashmeir Lajames Sterling

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Kashmeir Lajames Sterling.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter (22CM412) in Branch 17 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 17 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 13 if not resolved. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared in person in Court on 9/16/2022 requesting an adjournment of the 9/26/2022 status conference due to a conflict. Court grants a reschedule of the status conference to 10/27/2022 at 2:00 p.m.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared as a friend of the court for Kashmeir Lajames Sterling.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense counsel to be formally appointed soon. Discussion held regarding JusticePoint discharge report.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. 
All previously ordered conditions to apply. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kashmeir Lajames Sterling in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kashmeir Lajames Sterling appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
